titles.title: A bill to amend the National Parks and Recreation Act of 1978, as amended, to extend the term of the Delta Region Preservation Commission, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Executive Comment Requested from Interior.

Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston without amendment. With written report No. 100-251.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 480.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
House Agreed to Senate Amendments by Unanimous Consent.

committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests
committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources

bill.summary: 12/19/1987--Passed Senate amended. (Measure passed Senate, amended) Amends the National Parks and Recreation Act of 1978 to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to construct folk life centers in the Acadian region and to acquire lands to be developed and operated as the Jean Lafitte National Historical Park. Extends the term of the Delta Region Preservation Commission for another ten years, through November 10, 1998. (The Commission is to assist in site selection for a national park in the Delta Region of Louisiana.)
